SystemRequirements: Image Magick (for reading non PPM format), dcraw (for reading RAW images).
ADMIXTOOLS suite of command-line utilities for population genetics. See <https://reich.hms.harvard.edu/software> for the most recent installation instructions and further information.
Python (>= 3.6.0), (Python) Altair (>= 4.2.0), vega_datasets (>= 0.9.0). To use image functions for MacOS: X11
None, but greater than 12 GB of RAM highly recommended.

ImageMagick (http://imagemagick.org) or GraphicsMagick (http://www.graphicsmagick.org) or LyX (http://www.lyx.org) for saveGIF(); (PDF)LaTeX for saveLatex(); SWF Tools (http://swftools.org) for saveSWF(); FFmpeg (http://ffmpeg.org) or avconv (https://libav.org/avconv.html) for saveVideo()

The exact (anti)clustering algorithms require that either the GNU linear programming kit (GLPK library) is installed (<http://www.gnu.org/software/glpk/>) or the SYMPHONY open source MILP solver (<https://github.com/coin-or/SYMPHONY>). Rendering the vignette requires pandoc (<https://pandoc.org/>).
C++17; for AWS S3 support on Linux, libcurl and openssl (optional); cmake >= 3.16 (build-time only, and only for full source build)

FFmpeg (>= 3.2); with at least libx264 and lame (mp3) drivers. MacOS Homebrew: ffmpeg. Debian/Ubuntu: libavfilter-dev. Fedora/CentOS: either ffmpeg-free-devel or (via https://rpmfusion.org) ffmpeg-devel.
AWS Java SDK (see README.md for more details)

GDAL (>= 2.2.3): gdal-bin (deb), libgdal-dev (deb) or gdal-devel (rmp), GEOS (>= 3.4.0), PROJ (>= 4.9.3): libproj-dev (deb), sqlite3, ImageMagick++: imagemagick (deb), libmagic-dev (deb), libmagick++-dev (deb) or ImageMagick-c++-devel (rpm) ImageMagick (http://imagemagick.org) or GraphicsMagick (http://www.graphicsmagick.org) or LyX (http://www.lyx.org) for saveGIF(); (PDF)LaTeX for saveLatex(); SWF Tools (http://swftools.org) for saveSWF(); FFmpeg (http://ffmpeg.org) or avconv (https://libav.org/avconv.html) for saveVideo()
Rtools (>= 3.3) for Windows, Xcode (>= 9.0) for Mac OS X
grpc/protobuf headers and compilers. For example libprotobuf-dev libgrpc++-dev protobuf-compiler-grpc (Debian) or protobuf-devel grpc-devel grpc-plugins (Fedora/RHEL)

C++11. Also a few functions from package 'bigsnpr' wrap existing software such as 'PLINK' <www.cog-genomics.org/plink2>. Functions are provided to download these software. Note that these external software might not work for some operating systems (e.g. 'PLINK' might not work on Solaris).
A system with a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.8 or later).
'monobit' for reading/writing additional bitmap font formats.
LaTeX(texi2dvi) must be present in the system to create PDF reports
OpenBUGS (>= 3.2.2), hence Windows or x86 Linux
'Microsoft Visual Code', 'Rtools' on 'Windows', 'gdb' or 'lldb' depending on which OS
FFTW (>=3.3.1); possible package: fftw-devel (rpm), libfftw3-dev (deb) or fftw (brew).

Python and numpyro are needed for Bayesian inference computations; python (>= 3.8) with header files and shared library; numpyro (= v0.12.1; https://https://num.pyro.ai/en/latest/index.html); arviz (= v0.15.1; https://https://python.arviz.org/en/stable/)
Google Chrome or other Chromium-based browser. chromium: chromium (rpm) or chromium-browser (deb)
Cargo (Rust package manager), rustc and GNU Make
pandoc (to create a clinical data review report)
pandoc (for export clin DT to a file - inclusion of list of interactive plots/objects with knitr)

xclip (https://github.com/astrand/xclip) or xsel (http://www.vergenet.net/~conrad/software/xsel/) for accessing the X11 clipboard, or wl-clipboard (https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard) for systems using Wayland.

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb), libgmp3: apt-get install -y libgmp3-dev (deb), libfftw3: apt-get install -y libfftw3-dev (deb), libtiff5: apt-get install -y libtiff5-dev (deb)
MOSEK (http://www.mosek.com) and MOSEK License for use of Rmosek
awscli: apt install -y awscli (deb), aws-configure: aws configure (deb)
pdfcrop (part of TexLive) is required to rebuild the vignettes.
GNU make, pandoc (>=1.12.3, needed for vignettes)
none, one or more of JAGS (>= 3.0.0), WinBUGS (>= 1.4), OpenBUGS (>= 3.2.2), Stan
A version of Fortran supporting the LOG_GAMMA Intrinsic and the ieee_arithmetic module.
OpenSSL(>= 1.0.1), NVIDIA CUDA GPU with compute capability 3.0 or above and NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit 9.0 or above
fontconfig or zlib (only needed for platforms other than modern OSX and Windows)
LibreOffice (<https://www.libreoffice.org/>) required to extract data from .doc files or perform .pptx conversion.
'unrar' (Linux/macOS) or '7-Zip' (Windows) to work with '.rar' files, GDAL (>= 3.0.2), GEOS (>= 3.8.0), PROJ (>= 6.2.1)
Requires the OpenMP library for parallel computing. If the OpenMP library is not available, the code is executed sequentially and a warning is printed.
The package required the jq command line library. Please check https://stedolan.github.io/jq/download/ for download instructions.
The function render() requires Pandoc (http://pandoc.org). To use PGP/GnuPG encryption requires gpg.
JAGS (>= 4.0.0). For installation instructions, see http://mcmc-jags.sourceforge.net/

ProtoBuf libraries and compiler version 3.3.0 or later; On Debian/Ubuntu these can be installed as libprotoc-dev, libprotobuf-dev and protobuf-compiler, while on Fedora/CentOS protobuf-devel and protobuf-compiler are needed.

ProtoBuf libraries and compiler version 3.3.0 or later; On Debian/Ubuntu these can be installed as libprotoc-dev, libprotobuf-dev and protobuf-compiler, while on Fedora/CentOS protobuf-devel and protobuf-compiler are needed.

apt-get-pip: apt-get install -y python3-pip (deb), python3-pip: python3 -m pip install -U pip (deb), numpy: pip3 install -U numpy (deb), cv2: pip3 install -U opencv-python (deb), matplotlib: pip3 install -U matplotlib (deb), skimage: pip3 install -U scikit-image (deb), libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb)

Generally, fastText builds on modern Mac OS and Linux distributions. Since it uses some C++11 features, it requires a compiler with good C++11 support. These include a (g++-4.7.2 or newer) or a (clang-3.3 or newer).
fluidsynth: fluidsynth-devel (rpm) or libfluidsynth-dev (deb). On Linux you also need a soundfont provided by 'fluid-soundfont-gm' (Fedora) or 'sf3-soundfont-gm' (Debian/Ubuntu)

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb)
GNU Scientific Library (GSL). Note: users should have GSL installed.
Python (>= 2.4), difflib, fuzzywuzzy ( >=0.15.0 ), python-Levenshtein ( >=0.12.0 ). Detailed installation instructions for each operating system can be found in the README file.
Debian or Ubuntu system with access to Goto Blas, Intel MKL, Atlas development build as well as a Nvidia GPU with CUDA support
GDAL (>= 3.1.0, built against GEOS), PROJ, libxml2
GNU make, pandoc (>=1.12.3, needed for vignettes)
MongoDB (>= 3.4.0), Python (>= 2.7). Installation instructions and links can be found in the README file.
'unrar' (Linux/macOS) or '7-Zip' (Windows) to work with '.rar' files, C++11, GDAL (>= 2.0.1), GEOS (>= 3.8.0), PROJ (>= 6.2.1)

By default, git2r uses a system installation of the libgit2 headers and library. However, if a system installation is not available, builds and uses a bundled version of the libgit2 source. zlib headers and library. OpenSSL headers and library (non-macOS). LibSSH2 (optional on non-Windows) to enable the SSH transport.
GPGME: libgpgme-dev (deb), gpgme-devel (rpm) gpgme (brew). On Linux 'haveged' is recommended for generating entropy when using the GPG key generator.
C++11 (supporting at least std=c++0x), OpenCL shared library (provided by an SDK such as AMD/NVIDIA) and OpenCL headers including the C++ header file (provided by Khronos if not by SDK)
Python (>= 2.7.0) with header files and shared library; TensorFlow (v1.14; https://www.tensorflow.org/); TensorFlow Probability (v0.7.0; https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/)
Python (>= 2.7.0) with header files and shared library; TensorFlow (v1.14; https://www.tensorflow.org/); TensorFlow Probability (v0.7.0; https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/)
Python (>= 2.7.0) with header files and shared library; TensorFlow (v1.14; https://www.tensorflow.org/); TensorFlow Probability (v0.7.0; https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/)
Python (>= 3.6) with header files and shared library; H2O4GPU (https://github.com/h2oai/h2o4gpu)
V8 engine version 6+ is needed for modern JS and WASM support. On Debian / Ubuntu install either libv8-dev or libnode-dev, on Fedora use v8-devel.
Apache Hadoop >= 2.7.2 (https://hadoop.apache.org/releases.html#Download); Obsolete: Hadoop core >= 0.19.1 and <= 1.0.3 or CDH3 (https://www.cloudera.com); standard unix tools (e.g., chmod)
LaTeX packages: adjustbox, array, calc, caption, colortbl, fontspec, graphicx, hhline, hyperref, multirow, siunitx, tabularx, threeparttable, ulem, wrapfig
Julia (>= 1.0) and Interpretable AI System Image (>= 1.0.0)

gdal-bin: apt install -y gdal-bin (deb), libgdal-dev: apt install -y libgdal-dev (deb), libudunits2-dev: apt install -y libudunits2-dev (deb), libgeos-dev: apt install -y libgeos-dev (deb), libproj-dev: apt install -y libproj-dev (deb), unzip: apt install unzip (deb)
A C library with the fesetround/fegetround functions.
libtiff, libbz2, libdeflate, libjpeg, liblzma, libwebp, libzstd, zlib
C++17 or C++11 and OpenCV 3 or newer: libopencv-dev (Debian, Ubuntu) or opencv-devel (Fedora)
Impala driver to support a 'DBI'-compatible R interface

Complete functionality necessitates Amazon Corretto (win), and default-jre, pandoc, libxml2-dev, libpoppler-cpp-dev, libmagick++-dev, optipng, libtesseract-dev, libleptonica-dev, tesseract-ocr-eng (deb)
pandoc (to export an interactive summary table to a file)
GNU make and Java JDK 1.2 or higher

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb)
Optional: libsecret on Linux (libsecret-1-dev on Debian/Ubuntu, libsecret-devel on Fedora/CentOS)
Package vignettes based on R Markdown v2 or reStructuredText require Pandoc (http://pandoc.org). The function rst2pdf() requires rst2pdf (https://github.com/rst2pdf/rst2pdf).
At least trial version of LocalSolver to be downloaded from http://www.localsolver.com/download.html
C++11, A system with zoneinfo data (e.g. /usr/share/zoneinfo). On Windows the zoneinfo included with R is used.
Python 3.x with following modules: PyGMO, NumPy, and cloudpickle
ADMB version 11 <http://admb-project.org/> for use.admb=TRUE; see readme.txt

On a Unix-alike, one of the C functions mach_absolute_time (macOS), clock_gettime or gethrtime. If none of these is found, the obsolescent POSIX function gettimeofday will be tried.
memory (>= 4GB) Ubuntu: build-essential, libxml2-dev, libssl-dev, libcurl4-openssl-dev Windows: Rtools (>= 3.5)
A C++17 compiler. Version 8 or later of GCC will be fine.
gdal (optional), geos (optional), proj (optional), udunits (optional), gsl (optional), gmp (optional), glu (optional), jags (optional), mpfr (optional), openmpi (optional)

'libnng' >= 1.6 and 'libmbedtls' >= 2.5, or 'cmake' and 'xz' to compile NNG and/or Mbed TLS included in package sources
pandoc, jupyter, jupyter nbconvert ("nbconvert" python package), pywin32 (on windows)

JAGS (http://mcmc-jags.sourceforge.net/) for analysis of Bayesian hierarchical models

GNU make, An ODBC3 driver manager and drivers.

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb), libjpeg-dev: apt-get install -y libjpeg-dev (deb), libpng-dev: apt-get install -y libpng-dev (deb), libfftw3-dev: apt-get install -y libfftw3-dev (deb), libtiff5-dev: apt-get install -y libtiff5-dev (deb)
To use the Localhost of OSRM, you need to build OSRM <https://github.com/Project-OSRM/osrm-backend/wiki/Building-OSRM> locally
pandoc (https://johnmacfarlane.net/pandoc) for exporting markdown files to other formats.

The 'Japanese.Rnw' vignette requires uplatex and dvipdfmx.
OpenMPI (>= 1.5.4) on Linux, Mac, and FreeBSD. MS-MPI (Microsoft MPI v7.1 (SDK) and Microsoft HPC Pack 2012 R2 MS-MPI Redistributable Package) on Windows.

Linux, Mac OSX, and Windows, or 'ZeroMQ' library >= 4.0.4. Solaris 10 needs 'ZeroMQ' library 4.0.7 and 'OpenCSW'.

MERLIN (https://csg.sph.umich.edu/abecasis/merlin/) for calculations involving multiple linked markers.

pandoc (http://pandoc.org) for building Vignettes and output reports as HTML
'python3' needs to built for the same architecture R is built for (32 or 64 bit).

'QGIS' latest or long-term release currently supported according to the 'QGIS' release schedule (<https://www.qgis.org/en/site/getinvolved/development/roadmap.html>). Older 'QGIS' releases are not officially supported, but may work since 'QGIS' 3.16.
OpenBugs for functions bugs() and openbugs() or WinBUGS 1.4 for function bugs()
pandoc (https://johnmacfarlane.net/pandoc) for exporting markdown files to other formats.
package manual and Vignettes require pandoc (>= 1.14) http://pandoc.org)

python >= 2.6, by default rasciidoc uses a system installation of asciidoc. If a system installation of asciidoc is not available, it downloads the sources from (<http://gitlab.com/asciidoc>). GNU source-highlight is recommended.
Needs a running BaseX server instance. The testuser with credentials ('Test'/'testBasex') should have admin rights.
cmake, zlib, GNU make, Solaris: g++ is a requirement

A valid Bloomberg installation. The API headers and dynamic library are downloaded from <https://github.com/Rblp/blp> during the build step. See <https://bloomberg.github.io/blpapi-docs/cpp/3.8> as well as <https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/support/api-library/> for API documentation. A recent-enough compiler with C++11 support is required.
MOSEK (http://www.mosek.com) and MOSEK License for use of Rmosek,
IBM ILOG CPLEX libraries and headers

A 64-bit POSIX OS such as Linux or OS X with IANA time zone data in /usr/share/zoneinfo as well as a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.9 or later which is preferred, g++-4.8 works too). On Windows the zoneinfo included with R is used; and time parsing support is enabled via a backport of std::get_time from the LLVM libc++ library.

GNU make, pcre2 (>= 10.00), GLib (>= 2.0.0). On Windows, no prior installations are necessary, as pre-built (i.e. cross-compiled) binaries of required libraries are downloaded from a GitHub repository (<https://github.com/PolMine/libcl>) during installation. On macOS, static libraries of Glib are downloaded (<https://github.com/PolMine/libglib>) if Glib is not present.
A POSIX system. Currently Linux and OS X are known to work.
MeCab 0.996 (or mecab-ko 0.9.2) or higher, GNU make
GNU make, Intel TBB, Windows: cmd.exe and cscript.exe, Solaris: g++ is required

An available hiredis library (eg via package libhiredis-dev on Debian/Ubuntu, hiredis-devel on Fedora/RedHat, or directly from source from <https://github.com/redis/hiredis>) can be used but version 1.0.2 is also included and built on demand if needed. The optional 'rredis' package can be installed from the 'ghrr' 'drat' repo for additional illustrations and tests.
Python (>= 3.7), retriever (>= 3.0.0) (version must be listed to patch to allow parsing)
xclip (https://github.com/astrand/xclip) or xsel (http://www.vergenet.net/~conrad/software/xsel/) for accessing the X11 clipboard
GNU GSL for the GSL random-number generators

Rust 'cargo'; the crate 'libR-sys' must compile without error

Python (>= 3.7), rgf_python, scikit-learn (>= 0.18.0), scipy, numpy. Detailed installation instructions for each operating system can be found in the README file.

notepad.exe, mark.exe (>= 8.0) (or mark32.exe and mark64.exe) and rel_32.exe (see README.txt)
pandoc (>=2.11.3 with 'commonmark_x' processing and 'sourcepos' extension, needed for 'rmarkdown' formats).

GNU Make, GCC Compiler Suite (C and Fortran)
Oracle Instant Client or Oracle Database Client

A user API key (which one can request from the website at <http://www.pushbullet.com>), and one or more devices to push messages to which may be any one of an (Android or iOS) phone, a (Chrome or Firefox, or Opera or Safari) browser or the (Windows or Mac) desktop application provided the corresponding Pushbullet 'app' has been installed on any one of these.

GNU make, CMake (>= 3.10), pandoc, libarchive, libregex, libexpat, liblzma, libzstd, liblz4, libz2, libz, libbcrypt

mallinfo, hence Linux, MacOS or Windows

'SLiM' is a forward simulation software for population genetics and evolutionary biology. See <https://messerlab.org/slim/> for installation instructions and further information. The 'Python' coalescent framework 'msprime' and the 'tskit' module can by installed by following the instructions at <https://tskit.dev/>.
For playing sounds, a command line system tool for playing wav-files is required.
C++, arrow package with gzip codec, StarPU
For all functions resp. apps: pandoc, LaTeX. For the edapy() function resp. Statsomat/EDAPY app: Python (>=3).
LilyPond v2.22.1-2+ (needed for rendering sheet music or writing MIDI files)
A system with a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.8 or later).
Tesseract >= 3.03 (libtesseract-dev / tesseract-devel) and Leptonica (libleptonica-dev / leptonica-devel). On Debian you need to install the English training data separately (tesseract-ocr-eng)
pandoc (>= 1.12.3) suggested for using wordreg function; LaTeX packages tikz, booktabs, dcolumn, rotating, thumbpdf, longtable, paralist for the vignette

A C++17 compiler is required; on macOS compilation version 11.0 or later is required. Optionally cmake (only when TileDB source build selected), curl (only when TileDB source build selected)), and git (only when TileDB source build selected); on x86_64 and M1 platforms pre-built TileDB Embedded libraries are available at GitHub and are used if no TileDB installation is detected, and no other option to build or download was specified by the user.
Python (>= 2.7), python-gdal library (For Windows, gdal installed via OSGeo4W <https://trac.osgeo.org/osgeo4w/> recommended) clipboard
A system with zoneinfo data (e.g. /usr/share/zoneinfo) as well as a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.8 or later). On Windows the zoneinfo included with R is used.

Tcl/Tk (>= 8.6). To read and write other formats than PPM/PGM, PNG and GIF it is required the 'tkImg' for 'Tcl/Tk' (https://sourceforge.net/projects/tkimg/), or the debian 'libtk-img' package (Ubuntu) or the RPM 'tkimg' package (Fedora or openSUSE).
Rust tool chain w/ cargo, libclang/llvm-config
LibTorch (https://pytorch.org/); Only x86_64 platforms are currently supported except for ARM system running macOS.

libcurl: libcurl-devel (rpm) or libcurl4-openssl-dev (deb), GNU make.
To use image functions for MacOS: X11
virtuoso-opensource (Linux). For Mac & Windows, this package can automate Virtuoso installation.

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb)
fftw3, GNU make, sox, Ghostscript, libsndfile, GDAL
PhantomJS for taking screenshots, ImageMagick or GraphicsMagick and OptiPNG for manipulating images.
Java (>= 5.0); WordNet database files (direct download: <https://wordnetcode.princeton.edu/3.0/WNdb-3.0.tar.gz>; Debian and Fedora package: wordnet)
Fortran sources included in `tools/x13as_html` are compiled via `configure`.
'ghostscript' or 'pdftk' for editing pdf bookmarks and/or documentation info entries. 'exiftool' for editing pdf documentation info entries and/or xmp metadata.
